title: Epitaph for Titos Ailios Victorinos
support: Fragment of the lower part of a marble relief, probably belonging to a sarcophagus, with inscribed text on the moulding. The rear is smooth, with rough border projecting at the base. The feet of a person or a horse are preserved of the relief above the inscription. The surface is somewhat worn.

layout.p: The remains of one line of Greek letters, preceded by a plain cross (which may be a later addition), are preserved on the moulding at the base of the relief.

handNote.lettering: Slightly irregularly disposed letters, with a hedera between the first two words. In the text preserved by Gualtherus lunate epsilon, sigma and cursive omega are recorded, and interpuncts before the numerals.

date._: Later 2nd century CE or first half of 3rd century CE

provenanceFound._: First observed in the Cathedral of S. Agata.

provenanceObserved._: Only a fragment was preserved after the 17th century, seen by Mommsen in Museo Biscari, who believed it was modern. Seen later by Korhonen in magazzino superiore, Collezione Biscari.

location.address: Castello Ursino, Piazza Federico II di Svevia, 95121 Catania (CT)
